intro: Genoplesium arrectum, commonly known as the erect leek orchid, is an Australian native plant belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is a terrestrial herb with a short, erect stem and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces a single, upright spike of white or pale green flowers, which are often tinged with pink or purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically in rainforest or heathland areas. Genoplesium arrectum is listed as vulnerable due to habitat loss and is protected under various conservation laws.
